alert.note: Alert for Marion (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 12:57PM CDT until March 31 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PIKE...SOUTHEASTERN ADAMS COUNTIES IN WEST CENTRAL ILLINOIS AND SOUTHEASTERN MARION COUNTIES IN NORTHEASTERN MISSOURI... At 1257 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Fall Creek, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported golf ball size hail in Hannibal. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Payson around 100 PM CDT. Quincy Regional Airport around 105 PM CDT. Beverly around 110 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Clayton. This also includes Siloam Springs State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 172 near exit 2. Interstate 72 between exits 4 and 10. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Illinois...and northeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
